official_title: A bill to ensure the maintenance of a strong, reliable, and operational domestic uranium industry by requiring the Secretary of Energy to limit the use of nondomestic uranium by civilian nuclear power reactors.

summary.text: Nuclear Fuel Security Act of 1985 - Directs the Secretary of Energy to require by regulation that not less than 75 percent of source material or special nuclear material employed in specified facilities be derived from uranium that is mined and milled in the United States. Specifies exemptions. Authorizes the Secretary to revise such percentage once every five years. Suspends certain regulations issued by the Secretary for the purpose of assessing the viability of the domestic uranium industry, including the definition of viable domestic uranium industry.
